timeline.message:
Improve factories for `StepVerifier`s

Motivation:

1. `StepVerifiers.create` is a confusing name for users who prefer static
imports. Not obvious what the method is creating when you read the source
code of the test.
2. `Processor`s is a most common way to create a source for which users
can control emitted signals. However, users always have to use
`SourceAdapters.fromSource`, which is not convenient.

Modifications:

- Rename `StepVerifiers.create` -> `Verifiers.stepVerifiers`;
- Add `Verifiers.stepVerifiersForSource` methods for async sources;
- Use `Assert.assertThrows` instead of `try-catch + Assert.fail()`;

Result:

More convenient factory API for `StepVerifier`.

timeline.bodyText: If I use the same stepVerifier for PublisherSource, java is confused when an async source implements both types Publisher and PublisherSource (example: TestPublisher). Which approach will you prefer: different factory names or force users to use a concrete type?
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

replies.bodyText:
I'm fine with different factory method name especially if it will come up in common cases and require additional casting/effort.
fwiw ReactiveStreamsAdapters uses the same method name for both, but I guess this is less commonly used...
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: ah this is what you were asking for ... sorry I missed this and nice improvement 👍
